name: SwapDimensions
author: Oxford Centre for Functional MRI of the Brain (FMRIB)
description: this is an advanced tool that re-orders the data storage to permit changes between axial, sagittal and coronal slicing. When used in this mode the same left-right convention (also called coordinate handedness or radiological/neurological convention) will be maintained as long as no warning is printed.

inputs.name: In file
inputs.description: Input image to swap dimensions of

inputs.name: New X dimension
inputs.description: Representation of new x axes in terms of old cartesian axes.

inputs.name: New y dimension
inputs.description: Representation of new y axes in terms of old cartesian axes.

inputs.name: New Z dimension
inputs.description: Representation of new z axes in terms of old cartesian axes.

inputs.name: New X dimension
inputs.description: Representation of new x axes in terms of old anatomical axes.

inputs.name: New y dimension
inputs.description: Representation of new y axes in terms of old anatomical axes.

inputs.name: New Z dimension
inputs.description: Representation of new z axes in terms of old anatomical axes.

inputs.name: Out file
inputs.description: Output name of image, if not provided, writes to standard output.

output-files.name: Out file
output-files.description: Output name of image, if not provided, writes to standard output.
